c-0: ^Okay. RAM, also known as Random Access Memory, is a type of computer memory that temporarily stores data that the CPU needs to access quickly while a computer is running.
^It is a critical component in determining the performance of a computer, as it holds the data and instructions for currently running programs and processes.
^It is volatile memory, meaning that it only holds data while the computer is powered on. Once the computer is turned off, all of its data is lost.
^Unlike other storage types like hard drives, RAM allows data to be read and written in any order (random access).
^That results in making it much faster for the CPU to retrieve data from RAM than from other types of storage.
^Don't mention it. Good luck on your journey.
